snippet: The United States is still producing around $800 billion a year less in goods and services than it would if it the economy were at full health.
abstract: News analysis; United States is still producing around $800 billion a year less in goods and services than it would if it the economy were at full health; residential investment, durable goods consumption, state and local government spending, business investment in equipment, and federal government spending are major culprits in malaise.
lead_paragraph: The United States is still producing around $800 billion a year less in goods and services than it would if it the economy were at full health.

headline.main: Why Is the Economy Still Weak? Blame These Five Sectors
headline.print_headline: 5 Sectors to Blame for Economic Weakness
headline.content_kicker: A Recovery in Need of a Recovery
